title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <sburjan> I also get a lot of these  
11:35 <sburjan> 2012-11-21 12:25:12,081 [http://192.168.0.31:8080/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/group.png),%20linear-gradient(to%20bottom,%20] ERROR c.x.x.d.XWikiDocument          - Exception while cloning document  
11:35 <sburjan> java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: null  
11:37 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:51 <Enygma`> sburjan: that URL looks wrong, where you do access it?  
11:52 <sburjan> Enygma`: which one are you talking about ? the one I pasted or the one from the issue ?  
11:52 <Enygma`> the pasted one  
11:53 <silviar1> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <sburjan> I didn't do anything besides enabling the snapshot repos  
11:54 <sburjan> and I get them in console  
11:54 <silviar> has quit  
11:54 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <sburjan> you can the lastest jetty+hsqldb package to try to reproduce. I don't get these on rc1  
11:55 <rrodriguez> has quit  
11:56 <vmassol> sburjan: testing ircbot app on master  
11:58 <vmassol> sburjan: btw if you use e.x.o then the latest published is 4.2: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application  
11:58 <vmassol> that's normal  
11:59 <vmassol> I'm testing with my local repo now to test the 4.3-SNAPSHOT of it  
12:00 <vmassol> sburjan: works very well for me  
12:00 <vmassol> so on master with latest ircbot app and using my local repo  
12:04 <sburjan> vmassol: odd. I get ircbot version 4.2 installed on my rc1 and snapshot. Is this normal ?  
12:05 <vmassol> you need advanced search  
12:05 <vmassol> to install a snapshot  
12:06 <sburjan> ok, I see  
12:06 <sburjan> let me try again  
12:08 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <vmassol> sburjan: I've now installed from the snapshot repo and it worked too  
12:09 <vmassol> sburjan: version 4.2 of ircbot does not register itself in the app panel  
12:09 <vmassol> that's perfectly normal  
12:09 <vmassol> I'm going to close your issue  
12:16 <sburjan> vmassol: funny thing. I have installed ircbot without using the advanced search. this installed version 4.2. I removed version 4.2, but now when I use advanced search I have a upgrade button (don't know why since the previous version was removed) and pressing it I get http://pastebin.com/3mQ3JMtd  
12:17 <sburjan> and I am notified that version 4.2 is still installed. this must be another bug for sure  
12:18 <vmassol> how did you remove version 4.2?  
12:19 <sburjan> uninstall from "Installed Extensions"  
12:19 <vmassol> from the UI?  
12:19 <sburjan> yes  
12:19 <vmassol> ok then it's a bug IMO  
12:19 <vmassol> you should raise it  
12:19 <sburjan> thing is that I'm on snapshot, I hope this doesn't make it harder to reproduce. reporting  
12:22 <sburjan> reproduced also on 4.3-RC1. So it's not because of snapshots  
12:22 <crocket> Are you guys open on contributions nowadays?  
12:25 <crocket> Or open-minded?  
12:25 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:27 <Enygma`> what do you mean by that, crocket?  
12:28 <Enygma`> vmassol: should I create a new Jira component for Solr Search ?  
12:28 <Enygma`> right now I`ve added some issues directly to the Search Jira component, but that doesn`t feel quite right  
12:31 <sburjan> Enygma`: check skype message :)  
12:32 <crocket> Enygma`, I mean http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/devs/2012-November/052794.html  
12:32 <crocket> I think it can go into the core.  
12:33 <crocket> Nobody has written a component that helps users sort XWiki Objects by their properties.  
12:33 <crocket> I'm going to read about contribution in xwiki.org and try to push it to the core.  
12:34 <Enygma`> crocket: did you read http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing ?  
12:34 <crocket> I'll read about it this weekend.  
12:34 <crocket> Enygma`, I was reading it.  
12:35 <sburjan> vmassol: reported: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8476 hope it's clear enough  
12:35 <Enygma`> crocket: if you feel that something \*should\* (don`t read \*needs to\*) go into the core, then you can create a jira issue and attach a pull request. If it is not accepted into the core, then you can publish it as an extension which is easily installable with the Extension Manager.  
12:36 <crocket> Enygma`, Can you take a time to see my component? https://snowberry.me/xwiki/Sandbox/NetworkServices  
12:36 <crocket> It's demonstrated on https://snowberry.me/xwiki/Sandbox/NetworkServices  
12:36 <crocket> oops  
12:36 <crocket> There is an error  
12:37 <Enygma`> I understand, but if I had the time, I would have answered your mail  
12:38 <crocket> Enygma`, Please visit again http://snowberry.me/xwiki/Sandbox/NetworkServices  
12:38 <Enygma`> crocket: making a pull request is the way to make people look over your code, using the proper tools.  
12:38 <Enygma`> this way the right people get notified and, when they have the time, will review your code.  
12:38 <crocket> Enygma`, It compares the running times of XWQL and my component.  
12:39 <crocket> yeah  
12:39 <crocket> Enygma`, Is it that simple? just make a jira issue and attach a pull request on github?  
12:39 <evalica> crocket: today is a release day - I don't think anyone will have the time to review it today  
12:40 <crocket> I don't know which package my sort component belongs to.  
12:41 <crocket> If it had to go in the core, I'd need to choose the right package and the right maven groupId and artifactId.  
12:41 <cjd> nice services :)  
12:42 <crocket> I think it'll be discussed once there are a jira issue and a pull request on github.  
12:42 <cjd> Note that my opinion is nothing at all should be added to core unless it's actually making API which makes extensions easier to build..  
12:43 <crocket> cjd : hmm... ok  
12:43 <cjd> But we have a nice extension manager so things which were outright impossible just a year ago are really easy now  
12:44 <cjd> I'm not belittling your project, we need more metrics, especially performance metrics. It's just that I think it belongs in an extension, perhaps as part of AdminTools  
12:44 <crocket> cjd : I don't have a lot of data for performance metrics.  
12:45 <cjd> your small measurement of query performance is better than what we have at the moment ;)  
12:48 <crocket> cjd : Does $services.query belong to the core?  
12:49 <crocket> Or is it an extension?  
12:50 <cjd> IMO it should be an extension but it is currently in the core.  
12:50 <cjd> Keep in mind that many of these things existed prior to the extension manager so at that time we had no choice  
12:51 <Enygma`> cjd: the query module is an extension, AFAIK: xwiki-platform-query-manager  
12:51 <crocket> cjd : Keeping lots of components out of the core means people will submit many extensions with overlapped functionalities.  
12:51 <crocket> Enygma`, It got installed via a wizard.  
12:52 <Enygma`> crocket: what do you mean?  
12:52 <crocket> Enygma`, xwiki-platform-query-manager.  
12:52 <Enygma`> what you get by default in XWiki is not necesarily in the core  
12:52 <Enygma`> when you say core, you actually mean bundled by default  
12:52 <crocket> Enygma`, How did the wizard install this if it wasn't in the core?  
12:53 <Enygma`> but when I say core, I mean xwiki-platform-oldcore  
12:53 <crocket> ok  
12:53 <Enygma`> which is pretty much deprecated  
12:53 <Enygma`> we are moving to a completely extension-driver architecture  
12:53 <Enygma`> where every module is an extension  
12:53 <crocket> Enygma`, How can I make the wizard install my component?  
12:54 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:55 <Enygma`> you would have to add it to the XWiki Enterprise UI extension  
12:55 <crocket> Enygma`, But my component is not a UI extension.  
12:56 <Enygma`> right, in your case, you need to add it to the XWiki Enterprise Web extension  
12:57 <crocket> Enygma`, I skipped the wizard and installed UI extensions right away, then I couldn't see lots of stuff installed by the wizard.  
13:02 <crocket> Enygma`, Where on extensions.xwiki.org can I find XWiki Enterprise Web extension?  
13:05 <Enygma`> it does not have an extension page. AFAIK, it comes from the maven repository and it coresponds to the xwiki-platform-web maven artifact that gets translated into an extension to be installed with ExtensionManager.  
13:06 <Enygma`> stuff from the xwiki repositories can have extension pages that are used as documentation, but it's not mandatory. The actual extensions come from the maven repository.  
13:08 <crocket> Enygma`, So I make a JIRA issue and a pull requst on github for submission to xwiki-platform-web?  
13:12 <vmassol> cjd: seems there's a misconception about "IMO it should be an extension but it is currently in the core."  
13:12 <vmassol> what is in commons/rendering/platform/enterprise are not core things  
13:12 <vmassol> they're just extensions  
13:12 <vmassol> what is different about them from others is just that they are \*\*maintained\*\* by the xwiki dev team  
13:14 <vmassol> from a packaging POV, XE will become an almost empty shell with just the DM to let you install whatever you want in the not too far future  
13:17 <vmassol> crocket: you should ask to have your code put in xwiki-contrib  
13:17 <vmassol> see http://contrib.xwiki.org  
13:22 <vmassol> Enygma`: I'm not sure about the need for a separate component. If we do then we'll need  3 components: search ui, search lucene and search solr  
13:22 <vmassol> normally the rule we have so far is  
13:23 <vmassol> one jira component per top level module in platform-core  
13:23 <vmassol> but I agree that for large top level modules we might need to go one level deeper  
13:23 <vmassol> but in this case I think we need to materialize all sub modules  
13:23 <vmassol> ie the 3 I mentioned for search  
13:26 <crocket> ok  
13:27 <tmortagne> like we did for syntaxes in rendering  
13:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems your merges fixes are not enough to fix the issue  
13:28 <vmassol> jv restested it  
13:28 <vmassol> and found the same issue  
13:28 <Enygma`> ok, so for now I`ve created "Search - Solr"  
13:28 <tmortagne> I know and I just commited new fix  
13:28 <tmortagne> ( vmassol )  
13:28 <vmassol> ah ok cool  
13:28 <vmassol> didn't see the commit yet  
13:28 <vmassol> ah just now  
13:28 <vmassol> :)  
13:28 <tmortagne> there one a bug in BaseCollection and another one in XWikiDocument  
13:29 <tmortagne> we need a //TODO hunting day...  
13:29 <vmassol> :)  
13:31 <crocket> When will com.xpn.xwiki.api.Object move to an extension?  
13:31 <crocket> My component is centered around it.  
13:32 <vmassol> you can depend on oldcore  
13:32 <crocket> vmassol, Don't you plan to move it to an extension?  
13:32 <vmassol> it's alreayd an extesnsion  
13:33 <vmassol> maybe you mean component?  
13:35 <crocket> component?  
13:35 <crocket> vmassol, I get it.  
13:35 <crocket> It's not in the core.  
13:35 <crocket> xwik-platform-oldcore is an extention, too  
13:35 <crocket> extension  
13:35 <vmassol> it's  a jar extension  
13:35 <vmassol> but it's not coded with components yet  
13:36 <vmassol> (old stuff not moved to components yet)  
13:42 <vmassol> mflorea: you still have several issues without documentation for 4.3: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.3-milestone-1%22%2C+%224.3-milestone-2%22%2C+%224.3-rc-1%22%2C+%224.3%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Fixed%22%29+and+%28%28Documentation  
13:43 <vmassol> (4 issues)  
13:43 <mflorea> I know, I can't fix tests and document at the same time..  
13:43 <vmassol> we need 2 marius  
13:43 <mflorea> :)  
13:49 <crocket> I think a contrib project is a perfect chance for me.  
13:56 <Denis> has quit

14:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt?  
14:44 <vmassol> it's certainly important but do we want it a blocker?  
14:44 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <vmassol> ah the uninstall failed  
14:44 <vmassol> hmm  
14:44 <vmassol> indeed looks important  
14:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you on it?  
14:45 <sburjan> feel free to evaluate it and modify it how you think.  
14:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: (02:16:12 PM) tmortagne: sburjan: I'm currently trying to reproduce  
14:45 <vmassol> ok  
15:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: did not reproduce your issue yet but found other issue with uninstall on snapshot  
15:02 <tmortagne> trying to understand what's wrong  
15:02 <sburjan> tmortagne: I got my issues on rc-1 as well  
15:02 <sburjan> \*issue  
15:03 <sburjan> I am gonna try to reproduce it after I re-test the databases :)  
15:03 <tmortagne> sburjan: I git an issue before getting to yours  
15:03 <tmortagne> s/git/got/  
15:06 <vmassol> looking at the failing tests in platform  
15:06 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/job/xwiki-platform-4.3/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-linkchecker-test-tests/190/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.linkchecker.test.ui/LinkCheckerTest/testLinkChecker/  
15:06 <vmassol> the reason is because some click didn't work, so probably because the element wasn't ready  
15:07 <vmassol> working on it  
15:10 <jvdrean> has quit  
15:10 <tmortagne> sburjan: there is something I don't understand in your description  
15:11 <tmortagne> did  not seen it before but looks like you are trying to install a pom extension  
15:11 <tmortagne> org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-ircbot is not the ircbot UI  
15:11 <tmortagne> it's the root pom of ircbot module  
15:11 <sburjan> hmmm  
15:11 <sburjan> yes, that's what I was installing  
15:11 <sburjan> I was thinking that this is the one I have to install  
15:11 <tmortagne> note that I can't reproduce your issue  
15:11 <tmortagne> I don't have the upgrade button  
15:11 <tmortagne> on snapshot  
15:12 <sburjan> do you have the Install button ?  
15:12 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <sburjan> maybe your instance was able to properly uninstall the bot (version 4.2)  
15:12 <tmortagne> yes I have the install button  
15:13 <tmortagne> and it's telling me that this kind of extension is not supported when tryinig to install it  
15:13 <sburjan> interesting  
15:13 <tmortagne> which is normal since it's a "pom" extension  
15:14 <tmortagne> sburjan: it properly uninstalled the extension yes but looks like the UI have a bug hen displaying the result of the uninstall  
15:14 <tmortagne> looking at it  
15:14 <tmortagne> that's the issue I was talking about  
15:17 <sburjan> tmortagne: have you ever seen this ? Exception in thread "Core extension repository updater" Exception in thread "Timer-5" java.lang.NullPointerException  
15:18 <tmortagne> sburjan: no but do you have more ?  
15:18 <tmortagne> I know what it means but not what is the cause  
15:18 <sburjan> I am using the migration method vmassol told me yesterday from a 2.7.2 in tomcat to latest snapshot  
15:19 <tmortagne> "Core extension repository updater" is the thread which try to find more information about core extension from remote repositories  
15:19 <sburjan> yes, and it seems my wiki hangs :( http://pastebin.com/KS1dsd6Q  
15:20 <vmassol> mf   
15:20 <vmassol> s/mf//  
15:21 <sburjan> ok, starting from scartch to see if I can reproduce  
15:22 <tmortagne> sburjan: this thread is a backgroud thread with a very low priority, it should not have any influence on the XWiki startup  
15:23 <jvdrean> has quit  
15:23 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <tmortagne> sburjan: you don't have more than http://pastebin.com/KS1dsd6Q ?  
15:23 <sburjan> that's all of it  
15:25 <sburjan> where should the data dir to be located in a tomcat container ? I can't find it, can't say if it was created by my rc1 or not  
15:25 <vmassol> where you specified it!  
15:25 <vmassol> in xwiki.properties  
15:25 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's supposed to be wherever you tell it to be  
15:25 <sburjan> found it  
15:25 <vmassol> in environment.permanentDirectory  
15:26 <vmassol> if you haven't set it (which is bad) then it defaults to your temp dir  
15:26 <sburjan> I am using default/vanilla. It was in work dir under tomcat root  
15:26 <vmassol> you have a warning in the logs  
15:26 <vmassol> to say that no dir was set and it's default to such tmp dir  
15:29 <cdop> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <cdop> Hello :) So XWiki is up and running :) Thanks for this great piece of software!  
15:31 <cdop> \*but\* ;-) How could I switch Attachment-Uploads to "Minor Change" Version-Update? :)  
15:35 <sburjan> I get this http://pastebin.com/avBnqRvQ when stopping the tomcat with the 2.7.2 WAR deployed. I never got this using my older method :)  
15:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <sburjan> ok, it seems we have some issue, because now my migration fails on MySQL when I use my migration package. Creating issue  
15:42 <Enygma`> vmassol: what`s the status on the release? Can I push a minor bugfix?  
15:42 <Enygma`> in platform  
15:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: it's on hold till tmortagne gives me the go ahead re the issue found by sorin and till our functional tests are not passing  
15:43 <vmassol> if it's minor and not dangerous and you help fix the functional tests then ok  
15:43 <sburjan> I have another issue vmassol  
15:43 <sburjan> I am reporting it now  
15:43 <tmortagne> jvdrean still have issue with XWIKI-8461  
15:44 <sburjan> and I am reporting another blocker now :(  
15:44 <tmortagne> I'm looks at a UI bug in EM  
15:47 <vmassol> trying to figure out something strange, when running a functional UI test from my IDE, FF doesn't close anymore at the end of the test...  
15:49 <Enygma`> vmassol: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-4.3/ was not build since 4 days ago  
15:50 <Enygma`> seems like it needs to be jump-started manually  
15:50 <Enygma`> probably http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-mysql-4.3/ as well  
16:04 <sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol : http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8484  
16:04 <sburjan> I hope it's a mistake I've made

16:12 <sburjan> no. surely not  
16:12 <sburjan> I am confused because using my old (wrong way) of testing migration, this page always passed  
16:23 <evalica> has quit  
16:24 <tmortagne> sburjan: asking because it's not very clear in your steps  
16:25 <sburjan> tmortagne: trying again without the attached XAR  
16:25 <sburjan> also gonna make the issue more clear  
16:29 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know why there are 2 saves when I click import in e.x.o for an extension?  
16:30 <sburjan> tmortagne: seems that the issue happens even without my custom file, so gonna simplify the issue  
16:31 <tmortagne> there is the normal save and the listener which update the last version, installable with EM status etc.  
16:31 <tmortagne> you get the same message because the document is saved in a listener listening for document saved event  
16:31 <tmortagne> it's tricky in this area  
16:43 <mrvanes> has quit  
16:46 <sburjan> tmortagne: reproduced also on RC1.  
16:58 <vmassol> mflorea: I have an issue that i didn't have before with functional UI tests. When I run one test from my IDE the FF browser isn't closed automatically anymore. Have you noticed this too?  
16:58 <vmassol> even though we call driver.close() in AbstractTest.shutdown()  
16:58 <mflorea> vmassol: works fine for me  
16:59 <mflorea> I just run an ui test a few moments ago and FF was closed at the end  
16:59 <vmassol> strangely it's closed if I'm in debug mode  
16:59 <vmassol> and step through the driver.close()  
17:00 <vmassol> ok maybe some issue with my IDE then  
17:00 <vmassol> adding some logs  
17:01 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
17:14 <vmassol> mflorea: my guess is that driver.close() is not blocking anymore for some reason  
17:15 <vmassol> and the test closes before it has the chance to finish  
17:15 <vmassol> if I do:  
17:15 <vmassol>         this.driver.close();  
17:15 <vmassol> it workds  
17:15 <vmassol> \*works  
17:16 <mflorea> still the browser window should close, even with a delay (or  after the test finishes)  
17:19 <vmassol> ahah         this.driver.quit(); seems to work better  
17:20 <vmassol> quit() seems to close all windows while close() closes the current window  
17:20 <vmassol> http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/java/org/openqa/selenium/WebDriver.html#quit()  
17:21 <vmassol> I'll move our code to use quit()  
17:21 <mflorea> I see  
17:21 <mflorea> ok
